context: Year 2000 marked Accenture's transition from Andersen Consulting to an independent entity. The IT consulting market was dominated by large systems integrators and the Big Five accounting firms expanding their consulting practices. Y2K remediation projects were winding down, and companies were focused on enterprise systems implementation (especially ERP) and early e-business transformation.

competitors.name: IBM Global Services
competitors.notes: Major IT services and consulting competitor with global reach

competitors.name: Deloitte Consulting
competitors.notes: Big Five accounting firm with extensive technology consulting practice

competitors.name: PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC)
competitors.notes: Big Five firm offering IT consulting and business transformation services

competitors.name: KPMG Consulting
competitors.notes: Big Five firm with technology and management consulting services

competitors.name: Ernst & Young (EY)
competitors.notes: Big Five firm providing IT and business consulting

competitors.name: Capgemini
competitors.notes: European-based global IT consulting and outsourcing leader

competitors.name: McKinsey & Company
competitors.notes: Premier strategy consulting firm competing in high-end management consulting

competitors.name: Bain & Company
competitors.notes: Leading strategy consulting firm, part of 'Big Three'

competitors.name: CSC (Computer Sciences Corporation)
competitors.notes: Major IT services and systems integration company

competitors.name: EDS (Electronic Data Systems)
competitors.notes: Large IT services and business process outsourcing provider
